item.title: way of the world: from canada, lessons on revolution
item.description: the election of naheed nenshi, an ismaili muslim son of south asian migrants, as mayor of calgary, is a watershed event that should be of interest far beyond canada.

item.title: libya coalition launches 22 tomahawk strikes: u.s.
item.description: a coalition of countries conducting air strikes against libyan leader muammar gaddafi's forces launched 22 tomahawk missiles in the last 24 hours, the pentagon said on tuesday.

item.title: ireland's kenny promises bailout rates deal
item.description: irish prime minister enda kenny said on wednesday he would press for lower interest rates for dublin's eu/imf bailout but insisted higher corporate taxes would not be part of any such deal.

item.title: u.s. warns broadway theaters on security threats
item.description: u.s. safety regulators have told broadway theaters to update their emergency plans, a reminder that the aging buildings near new york's times square may need to evacuate as some did during a failed bomb plot a year ago.

item.title: 'captain america': a different kind of superhero
item.description: he's just a man on a mission, with no angst, dark impulses or other trendy problems.

item.title: jared sullinger says he'll be back at ohio state next year
item.description: after ohio state's loss to kentucky in the east regional semifinals, star freshman jared sullinger offered some good news to buckeyes fans.

item.title: u.s. volleyballer has head injury from brazil crash
item.description: u.s. olympic volleyball player stacy sykora is in intensive care with a head injury after the bus carrying her brazilian team crashed on its way to a match.

item.title: axa keeps 2011 outlook, q1 sales down 2 percent
item.description: axa on thursday said it was confident it would raise profits this year in spite of a drop in first-quarter sales as europe's second-biggest insurer implements a strategy shift focused on improving margins.

item.title: winds spare city threatened by texas wildfires
item.description: shifting winds gave some relief to texans menaced by wildfires that have scorched more than 230,000 acres near rural towns but forecasts point to more fire potential in coming days, officials said saturday.

item.description: it pays to do some homework before calling an appliance repairman.

item.title: factbox: deadliest tornado days in u.s. history
item.description: more than 250 people were killed in seven southern u.s. states in one of the deadliest series of tornadoes to hit the united states in recent decades, officials said on thursday.

item.title: schwarzenegger to star in proposed new "terminator"
item.description: he said he would be back, and now arnold schwarzenegger is doing just that.

item.title: court condemns uruguay for a disappearance
item.description: human rights experts see the case, related to a woman's abduction in the 1970s, as a watershed for ending impunity for crimes against humanity committed under uruguay's military dictatorship.

item.title: glenn beck contemplates starting own channel
item.description: when his contract with fox ends, mr. beck may bring his audience along, either to cable or an expanded web site.

item.description: militants ambushed a convoy of pakistani troops near the afghan border, killing 11 of them, a government official said.

item.title: crews fight major wildfires in texas, governor tours damage
item.description: firefighters in drought-stricken texas battled 14 major wildfires on tuesday and braced for dangerously dry and windy weather conditions on wednesday.

item.title: india offers $5 billion to africa in bid to boost ties
item.description: india stepped up its push to deepen its economic ties with africa and emerge from the shadow of rival china by offering $5 billion to help the continent rich with minerals and commodities.

item.description: bruce pearl, under investigation for n.c.a.a. recruiting violations, seemed caught off guard by comments from the vols' athletic director, mike hamilton, during a radio interview that aired wednesday.

item.description: the former baseball star is accused of using bogus information to lease a car from a dealership.

item.description: the national labor relations board will hear the n.f.l.'s arguments that the players' union negotiated in bad faith before disbanding.

item.description: game on! bloggers tom weir and reid cherner won't need to go to the eighth district court to resolve their differences.

item.title: japan's top-notch tsunami preparation may have prevented worst
item.description: half a century of expertise in dealing with disasters in japan, where earthquakes are a way of life, probably saved thousands of lives after friday's massive tremor, but even that finely honed response system could not prevent widespread devastation.

item.description: at loft 107 in williamsburg, graduates of rehab share a comfortable loft with its own cook.

item.title: woman convicted in 1993 "buried-alive" kidnapping to be paroled
item.description: a woman in prison 18 years for her role in a sensational 1993 kidnapping of a new york businessman who was buried alive for nearly two weeks has been granted parole, officials said on wednesday.

item.title: sanofi's diabetes drug cuts blood sugar, weight
item.description: sanofi's candidate drug lyxumia, or lixisenatide, added to basal insulin, significantly reduced blood sugar levels in type 2 diabetes patients and also led to a loss in weight, data published on tuesday showed.

item.title: ebay earnings rise in first quarter
item.description: the company reported wednesday that net income in the first quarter rose 20 percent to $475.9 million, or 36 cents a share, from $398 million, or 30 cents, in the year-ago quarter.

item.title: chris brown tops u.s. album chart for first time
item.description: ramp;b singer chris brown, dogged in recent years by a domestic violence conviction, scored his first no. 1 album on the u.s. pop chart wednesday with one of the best sales weeks of his career.

item.title: broadway posts larger takings for past season
item.description: broadway theaters increased gross revenues in the 2010/11 season, as the u.s. economy emerged from recession, while attendance figures have stayed relatively steady in the past five years.

item.title: hall of fame defensive end robustelli dies at 85
item.description: nfl hall of famer andy robustelli, a pro bowl defensive end for the los angeles rams and new york giants and a consistent winner on the gridiron, died on tuesday at age 85, the nfl said.

item.title: detroit's verlander throws no-hitter
item.description: justin verlander has thrown his second career no-hitter and the second in the big leagues this week, leading the detroit tigers to a 9-0 victory over the toronto blue jays on saturday.

item.title: blagojevich says prosecutors thwarting his corruption defense
item.description: former illinois governor rod blagojevich criticized prosecutors on wednesday for trying to bar his lawyers from telling jurors that wiretaps admitted as evidence against him represent only a fraction of secret recordings made on the eve of his 2008 arrest.

item.title: with japan out, skating worlds to get new site

item.title: accused tucson shooter due in court for competency hearing
item.description: accused tucson shooting suspect jared loughner will appear in federal court in arizona on wednesday for a hearing to determine whether he is mentally competent to stand trial.

item.title: dispatching the worn narrative of the 2006 finals
item.description: the miami heat and dallas mavericks did indeed meet in the 2006 finals, but the changes within both franchises -- and the league at large -- since that time makes the thought of the 2011 finals as a "rematch" a bit ridiculous.

item.title: internet tied to growth in u.s. prescription drug abuse
item.description: access to rogue online pharmacies may be driving a rapid increase in the abuse of prescription drugs like powerful painkillers percocet and oxycontin, a new study shows.

item.description: warner music group, which is being bought by billionaire len blavatnik's access industries, reported a narrower-than-expected quarterly loss, helped by a 9 percent jump in digital revenue.

item.description: industry and safety advocates are sparring over whether enough is being done to prevent fatal accidents.

item.description: china's wheat crop is suffering from a serious outbreak of disease and the spread of pests this year due to the dry spring, the ministry of agriculture said.

item.description: germany's sandra gal, wielding a red-hot putter, charged into a share of the early lead in the opening round of the kraft nabisco championship on thursday.

item.title: elpida says expects no supply interruptions following quake

item.title: "vampire diaries" creator opens up about show
item.description: one of the most talked about shows on u.s. network cw, "the vampire diaries," has given the young adult set an edgier, sexier "twilight" for the small screen. but sustaining the fast-paced storytelling, balancing an ensemble cast and taking on showrunning duties on a popular series isn't without its challenges. even with regular web buzz, the thursday drama averaged less than 3 million viewers and a 1.3 rating in the 18-49 demo in its most recent airing.

item.title: vital signs: disparities: illness more prevalent among older gay adults
item.description: older lesbian, gay and bisexual adults in california are more likely to suffer from chronic physical and mental health problems than their heterosexual counterparts, an analysis finds.
